text: Norman Robert "Bud" Poile (February 10, 1924 – January 4, 2005) was a Canadian professional ice hockey player, coach, general manager, and league executive. ==Awards== * Awarded the Lester Patrick Trophy in 1989. * Inducted into the NHL Hockey Hall of Fame in 1990. ==Career statistics== Regular season Playoffs Season Team League GP G A Pts PIM GP G A Pts PIM 1942–43 Toronto Maple Leafs NHL 48 16 19 35 24 6 2 4 6 4 1943–44 Toronto Maple Leafs NHL 11 6 8 14 9 — — — — — 1945–46 Toronto Maple Leafs NHL 9 1 8 9 0 — — — — — 1946–47 Toronto Maple Leafs NHL 59 19 17 36 19 7 2 0 2 2 1947–48 Toronto Maple Leafs NHL 4 2 0 2 3 — — — — — 1947–48 Chicago Black Hawks NHL 54 23 29 52 14 — — — — — 1948–49 Chicago Black Hawks NHL 4 0 0 0 2 — — — — — 1948–49 Detroit Red Wings NHL 56 21 21 42 6 10 0 1 1 2 1949–50 New York Rangers NHL 28 3 6 9 8 12 2 5 7 10 1949–50 Boston Bruins NHL 38 16 14 30 6 — — — — — 1950–51 Tulsa Oilers USHL 60 15 38 53 48 9 5 6 11 4 1951–52 Glace-Bay Miners MMHL 84 33 60 93 69 — — — — — 1952–53 Edmonton Flyers WHL 70 20 29 49 62 15 0 7 7 12 1953–54 Edmonton Flyers WHL 49 12 39 51 34 13 3 9 12 0 1954–55 Edmonton Flyers WHL 3 1 2 3 0 — — — — — NHL totals 311 107 122 229 91 35 6 10 16 18 ==Coaching statistics== Season Team League Type G W L T OTL Pct 1952–53 Edmonton Flyers WHL Head Coach 60 21 28 11 0 .442 1953–54 Edmonton Flyers WHL Head Coach 70 29 30 11 0 .493 1954–55 Edmonton Flyers WHL Head Coach 70 39 20 11 0 .636 1955–56 Edmonton Flyers WHL Head Coach 70 33 34 3 0 .493 1956–57 Edmonton Flyers WHL Head Coach 70 39 27 4 0 .586 1957–58 Edmonton Flyers WHL Head Coach1 ?
